com.samskivert.jdbc

Class MySQLLiaison

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samskivert.jdbc.BaseLiaison
      • com.samskivert.jdbc.MySQLLiaison
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DatabaseLiaison

    public class MySQLLiaison
extends BaseLiaison
    A database liaison for the MySQL database.

      Returns the proper SQL to identify an index.
      boolean isDuplicateRowException(SQLException sqe)
      Determines whether or not the supplied SQL exception was caused by a duplicate row being inserted into a table with a unique key.
      boolean isTransientException(SQLException sqe)
      Determines whether or not the supplied SQL exception is a transient failure, meaning one that is not related to the SQL being executed, but instead to the environment at the time of execution, like the connection to the database having been lost.

      Indicates whether or not this database liaison is the proper liaison for the specified database URL.

      • matchesURL

        public boolean matchesURL(String url)
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseLiaison
        Indicates whether or not this database liaison is the proper liaison for the specified database URL.
        Specified by:
        matchesURL in interface DatabaseLiaison
        Specified by:
        matchesURL in class BaseLiaison
        Returns:
        true if we should use this liaison for connections created with the supplied URL, false if we should not.

      • isDuplicateRowException

        public boolean isDuplicateRowException(SQLException sqe)
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseLiaison
        Determines whether or not the supplied SQL exception was caused by a duplicate row being inserted into a table with a unique key.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:
        isDuplicateRowException in class BaseLiaison
        Returns:
        true if the exception was caused by the insertion of a duplicate row, false if not.

      • isTransientException

        public boolean isTransientException(SQLException sqe)
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseLiaison
        Determines whether or not the supplied SQL exception is a transient failure, meaning one that is not related to the SQL being executed, but instead to the environment at the time of execution, like the connection to the database having been lost.
        Specified by:
        isTransientException in interface DatabaseLiaison
        Specified by:
        isTransientException in class BaseLiaison
        Returns:
        true if the exception was thrown due to a transient failure, false if not.

      • createGenerator

        public void createGenerator(Connection conn,
                            String tableName,
                            String columnName,
                            int initValue)
                     throws SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseLiaison
        Initializes the column value auto-generator described in DatabaseLiaison.lastInsertedId(java.sql.Connection, java.lang.String, java.lang.String). This should be idempotent (meaning the generator may already exist in which case this method should have no negative effect like resetting it).
        Specified by:
        createGenerator in interface DatabaseLiaison
        Specified by:
        createGenerator in class BaseLiaison
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • lastInsertedId

        public int lastInsertedId(Connection conn,
                          Statement istmt,
                          String table,
                          String column)
                   throws SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseLiaison
        Attempts as dialect-agnostic an interface as possible to the ability of certain databases to auto-generated numerical values for i.e. key columns; there is MySQL's AUTO_INCREMENT and PostgreSQL's DEFAULT nextval(sequence), for example.
        Specified by:
        lastInsertedId in interface DatabaseLiaison
        Overrides:
        lastInsertedId in class BaseLiaison
        istmt - the insert statement that generated the keys. May be null if the ORM doesn't have the statement handy.
        Returns:
        the requested inserted id.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if we are unable to obtain the last inserted id.

        public boolean addIndexToTable(Connection conn,

                               List<String> columns,
                               String ixName,
                               boolean unique)
                        throws SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseLiaison
        Adds a named index to a table on the given columns. Returns true or false if the database did or did not report a schema modification.

      • renameColumn

        public boolean renameColumn(Connection conn,
                            String table,
                            String oldColumnName,
                            String newColumnName,
                            ColumnDefinition newColumnDef)
                     throws SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseLiaison
        Alter the name, but not the definition, of a given column on a given table. Returns true or false if the database did or did not report a schema modification.
        Specified by:
        renameColumn in interface DatabaseLiaison
        Overrides:
        renameColumn in class BaseLiaison
        newColumnDef - the full definition of the new column, including its new name (MySQL requires this for a column rename).
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • columnSQL

        public String columnSQL(String column)
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseLiaison
        Returns the proper SQL to identify a column. Some databases require columns names to be quoted.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:
